Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 12:15AM topo wrote: Love all the pictures. We have 5 dogs and 9 cats. All live together in the same house. And for the most part they all get along. Of course they're all neutered and spayed. Each of them has a different personality. I love them all. Joan
Posts.Title: Your Furry Buddy JoyRebecca heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 12:50AM topo wrote:  This is Gabby. I rescued her from a state park I used to work at. Her mama had died and she was all by herself. I buried her mama and took this 6 wks old kitten home. I meowed at her for about ten minutes trying to keep her from running. It worked. She likes to perch on the back of my computer chair, kinda like a parrot and then gives me kisses. Joan

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 01:57AM topo wrote: Hi, This is my second go round with chemo. Have been on Abraxane and Avastin since June. Had treatments three weeks on with Avastin on the first and third week. Skipped chemo on week four. Recently, my onc stopped the Avastin for a while. Now I'm just doing Abraxane every other week. Side effects from Avastin included blisters on my hands, neuropathy in my hands and feet and low hemoglobin counts. While having both in my treatments, my liver spots have disappeared and the pleural effusion is significantly less. My tumor markers have also fallen to nearly normal. We will probably go back to the Avastin in a month. I don't know how long I'll have to be on this but so far so good. I also wondered why this combo of drugs isn't used as a first line chemo. Avastin was originally used just for metastatic colon cancer and non-small cell lung cancer. I am not positive that it's been approved yet for breast cancer, but we still have been able to use it. Best to you all. Topo
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63
